page.title: 18Retirement to Countryside.
page.content: Our immediate area is one of elderly people. We do not have the security of young people next door or across the way to call upon in a crisis. We are self-reliant folk. We are not the village people at all, we mostly come from London. However, we take part in village activities with enthusiasm, rather dividing the community into two, the true villagers and the 'foreigners'. How did this happen? Probably because of tempting bungalows advertised in London. It is fine at first for the newly pensioned couples; good gardens and allotments near at hand for Dad and many activities for Mum to join. But time, and perhaps one of the couple, passes on and the garden becomes a burden rather than a pleasure. So they leave the village and the area becomes one of constant change.
